text_tokenized: XI It may be possible to do without dancing entirely . Instances have

text: been known of young people passing many , many months successively , without being at any ball of any description , and no material injury accrue either to body or mind;--but when a beginning is made-- when the felicities of rapid motion have once been , though slightly , felt -- it must be a very heavy set that does not ask for more .

text: Frank Churchill had danced once at Highbury , and longed to dance again ; and the last half - hour of an evening which Mr. Woodhouse was persuaded to spend with his daughter at Randalls , was passed by the two young people in schemes on the subject .

text: Frank 's was the first idea ; and his the greatest zeal in pursuing it ; for the lady was the best judge of the difficulties , and the most solicitous for accommodation and appearance . But still she had inclination enough for shewing people again how delightfully Mr. Frank Churchill and Miss Woodhouse danced -- for doing that in which she need not blush to compare herself with Jane Fairfax -- and even for simple dancing itself , without any of the wicked aids of vanity -- to assist him first in pacing out the room they were in to see what it could be made to hold -- and then in taking the dimensions of the other parlour , in the hope of discovering , in spite of all that Mr. Weston could say of their exactly equal size , that it was a little the largest .

text: A private dance , without sitting down to supper , was pronounced an infamous fraud upon the rights of men and women ; and Mrs. Weston must not speak of it again .

text: She then took another line of expediency , and looking into the doubtful room , observed , " I do not think it _ is _ so very small .
text_tokenized: She then took another line of expediency , and looking into the doubtful room , observed , " I do not think it _ is _ so very small .

text: We shall not be many , you know . "
text_tokenized: We shall not be many , you know . "

text: And Mr. Weston at the same time , walking briskly with long steps through the passage , was calling out , " You talk a great deal of the length of this passage , my dear .
text_tokenized: And Mr. Weston at the same time , walking briskly with long steps through the passage , was calling out , " You talk a great deal of the length of this passage , my dear .

text: It is a mere nothing after all ; and not the least draught from the stairs .
text_tokenized: It is a mere nothing after all ; and not the least draught from the stairs .

text: " " I wish , " said Mrs. Weston , " one could know which arrangement our guests in general would like best .
text_tokenized: " " I wish , " said Mrs. Weston , " one could know which arrangement our guests in general would like best .

text: To do what would be most generally pleasing must be our object -- if one could but tell what that would be . " " Yes , very true , " cried Frank , " very true .
text_tokenized: To do what would be most generally pleasing must be our object -- if one could but tell what that would be . " " Yes , very true , " cried Frank , " very true .

text: You want your neighbours ' opinions . I do not wonder at you .
text_tokenized: You want your neighbours ' opinions . I do not wonder at you .

text: If one could ascertain what the chief of them -- the Coles , for instance .
text_tokenized: If one could ascertain what the chief of them -- the Coles , for instance .

text: They are not far off . Shall I call upon them ? Or Miss Bates ?
text_tokenized: They are not far off . Shall I call upon them ? Or Miss Bates ?

text: She is still nearer.-- And I do not know whether Miss Bates is not as likely to understand the inclinations of the rest of the people as any body .
text_tokenized: She is still nearer.-- And I do not know whether Miss Bates is not as likely to understand the inclinations of the rest of the people as any body .

text: I think we do want a larger council .
text_tokenized: I think we do want a larger council .

text: Suppose I go and invite Miss Bates to join us ?
text_tokenized: Suppose I go and invite Miss Bates to join us ?

text: " " Well -- if you please , " said Mrs. Weston rather hesitating , " if you think she will be of any use . " " You will get nothing to the purpose from Miss Bates , " said Emma .
text_tokenized: " " Well -- if you please , " said Mrs. Weston rather hesitating , " if you think she will be of any use . " " You will get nothing to the purpose from Miss Bates , " said Emma .

text: " She will be all delight and gratitude , but she will tell you nothing .
text_tokenized: " She will be all delight and gratitude , but she will tell you nothing .

text: She will not even listen to your questions .
text_tokenized: She will not even listen to your questions .

text: I see no advantage in consulting Miss Bates .
text_tokenized: I see no advantage in consulting Miss Bates .

text: " " But she is so amusing , so extremely amusing !
text_tokenized: " " But she is so amusing , so extremely amusing !

text: I am very fond of hearing Miss Bates talk .
text_tokenized: I am very fond of hearing Miss Bates talk .

text: And I need not bring the whole family , you know .
text_tokenized: And I need not bring the whole family , you know .

text: " Here Mr. Weston joined them , and on hearing what was proposed , gave it his decided approbation .
text_tokenized: " Here Mr. Weston joined them , and on hearing what was proposed , gave it his decided approbation .

text: " Aye , do , Frank.--Go and fetch Miss Bates , and let us end the matter at once
text_tokenized: " Aye , do , Frank.--Go and fetch Miss Bates , and let us end the matter at once

text: She will enjoy the scheme , I am sure ; and I do not know a properer person for shewing us how to do away difficulties .
text_tokenized: She will enjoy the scheme , I am sure ; and I do not know a properer person for shewing us how to do away difficulties .

text: Fetch Miss Bates .
text_tokenized: Fetch Miss Bates .

text: We are growing a little too nice .
text_tokenized: We are growing a little too nice .

text: She is a standing lesson of how to be happy .
text_tokenized: She is a standing lesson of how to be happy .

text: But fetch them both .
text_tokenized: But fetch them both .

text: Invite them both .
text_tokenized: Invite them both .

text: " Both sir !
text_tokenized: " Both sir !

text: Can the old lady ? " . . . " The old lady !
text_tokenized: Can the old lady ? " . . . " The old lady !

text: No , the young lady , to be sure .
text_tokenized: No , the young lady , to be sure .

text: I shall think you a great blockhead , Frank , if you bring the aunt without the niece . " " Oh !
text_tokenized: I shall think you a great blockhead , Frank , if you bring the aunt without the niece . " " Oh !

text: I beg your pardon , sir .
text_tokenized: I beg your pardon , sir .

text: I did not immediately recollect .
text_tokenized: I did not immediately recollect .

text: Undoubtedly if you wish it , I will endeavour to persuade them both .
text_tokenized: Undoubtedly if you wish it , I will endeavour to persuade them both .

text: " And away he ran .
text_tokenized: " And away he ran .

text: Long before he reappeared , attending the short , neat , brisk - moving aunt , and her elegant niece,--Mrs . Weston , like a sweet - tempered woman and a good wife , had examined the passage again , and found the evils of it much less than she had supposed before-- indeed very trifling ; and here ended the difficulties of decision .
text_tokenized: Long before he reappeared , attending the short , neat , brisk - moving aunt , and her elegant niece,--Mrs . Weston , like a sweet - tempered woman and a good wife , had examined the passage again , and found the evils of it much less than she had supposed before-- indeed very trifling ; and here ended the difficulties of decision .

text: All the rest , in speculation at least , was perfectly smooth .
text_tokenized: All the rest , in speculation at least , was perfectly smooth .

text: All the minor arrangements of table and chair , lights and music , tea and supper , made themselves ; or were left as mere trifles to be settled at any time between Mrs. Weston and Mrs. Stokes.-- Every body invited , was certainly to come ; Frank had already written to Enscombe to propose staying a few days beyond his fortnight , which could not possibly be refused .
text_tokenized: All the minor arrangements of table and chair , lights and music , tea and supper , made themselves ; or were left as mere trifles to be settled at any time between Mrs. Weston and Mrs. Stokes.-- Every body invited , was certainly to come ; Frank had already written to Enscombe to propose staying a few days beyond his fortnight , which could not possibly be refused .

text: And a delightful dance it was to be .
text_tokenized: And a delightful dance it was to be .

text: Most cordially , when Miss Bates arrived , did she agree that it must . As a counsellor she was not wanted ; but as an approver , ( a much safer character , ) she was truly welcome .
text_tokenized: Most cordially , when Miss Bates arrived , did she agree that it must . As a counsellor she was not wanted ; but as an approver , ( a much safer character , ) she was truly welcome .

text: Her approbation , at once general and minute , warm and incessant , could not but please ; and for another half - hour they were all walking to and fro , between the different rooms , some suggesting , some attending , and all in happy enjoyment of the future .
text_tokenized: Her approbation , at once general and minute , warm and incessant , could not but please ; and for another half - hour they were all walking to and fro , between the different rooms , some suggesting , some attending , and all in happy enjoyment of the future .

text: The party did not break up without Emma 's being positively secured for the two first dances by the hero of the evening , nor without her overhearing Mr. Weston whisper to his wife , " He has asked her , my dear .

text: That 's right .

text: I knew he would ! "
